answers.prompt: a) Browse public project and file catalogues
b) Create a project
c) Download Files
d) Upload Files
e) All of the above

questionOptions.prompt: As a "certified" Synapse user, I can:

answers.prompt: a) Browse public project and file catalogues
b) Create a project
c) Download Files
d) Upload Files
e) All of the above

questionOptions.prompt: If I am not logged into Synapse ("anonymous user"), I can:

answers.prompt: a) Browse public project and file catalogues
b) Create a project
c) Download Files
d) Upload Files
e) All of the above

questionOptions.prompt: As a "registered" Synapse user, I can (choose all that are true):

answers.prompt: a) To make sure that animal research is conducted in an ethical manner.
b) To ensure that use of the data meets all applicable human subjects research regulations.
c) Because of the sensitive nature of the data, its use must be monitored.

questionOptions.prompt: Why do some Controlled datasets require IRB review as a condition for use  (choose all that are true)?

answers.prompt: a) When required by informed consent, legal contract or other privacy requirements
b) When the content is already publicly available elsewhere
c) When the content is from a "vulnerable" population
d) When the content could potentially harm individuals or groups if misused

questionOptions.prompt: When is it NOT necessary to add 'Conditions for Use' to my content?

answers.prompt: a) Nothing, this isn’t my concern.
b)  Click the 'Report Issue' Flag next to the file name to alert the Synapse Access and Compliance Team.

questionOptions.prompt: A data file containing sensitive human health information is available on Synapse without data use conditions.  You believe this is an error. What should you do (choose one)?

answers.prompt: a) When I create a new project, the content is shared with the public by default.
b) When I create a new project,  I am the only one who has access to it but I may change this using the sharing settings
c) When I place data with use restrictions into a public project, I can ensure that downstream users comply with these restrictions by setting the appropriate 'Conditions for Use' on the data.

questionOptions.prompt: Which of the following statements about the Synapse sharing settings are true (choose all that are true)?

answers.prompt: a) Sharing settings and data use conditions are the same thing.
b) Sharing settings are used to control who can view Synapse content.
c) 'Conditions for Use' are used to enforce data use restrictions that are associated with the content of a file or folder.
d) To share Synapse content in a limited fashion with a group of my close collaborators, I use the Sharing setting and not the  'Conditions for Use'.

questionOptions.prompt: Which of the following statements about sharing settings and data use conditions are true (choose all that are true)?

answers.prompt: a) The Synapse ACT monitors use of content that I have placed in a private project.
b) The Synapse ACT performs quarterly audits to ensure that public content is shared on Synapse with the appropriate Conditions for Use.
c)  The Synapse ACT actively monitors use of all public content subject to 'Conditions for Use' that is openly shared with the public.

questionOptions.prompt: Which of the following statements about sharing settings and data use conditions are true (choose all that are true)?

answers.prompt: a) It's my boss, so it's okay to do this.
b) Ignore the request and hope he/she forgets.
c) Decline the request and remind my supervisor that using someone else’s credentials is against Synapse policy.

questionOptions.prompt: Your supervisor is very busy and asks you to log onto Synapse using his/her credentials to retrieve Controlled Use data.  What should you do?

answers.prompt: a) It's my friend, so it's okay to do this.
b) Ignore the request and hope he/she forgets.
c) Decline the request and remind your friend that you are not permitted to redistribute Controlled Use data from Synapse.

questionOptions.prompt: Your friend is very busy and asks you to give them a copy of Controlled Use data that you downloaded from Synapse.    What should you do?

answers.prompt: a) Data without use restrictions can be shared with other registered Synapse users.
b) Any data that I download from Synapse can be reposted in another database.
c) I can freely share any data downloaded from Synapse with my collaborators.

questionOptions.prompt: Which of the following statements is true?

answers.prompt: a) Anyone over 13 years old
b) Only researchers in an accredited academic institution
c) Only people working at not-for-profit research organizations
d) Anyone that does not work at a for profit organization

questionOptions.prompt: Who can register for a Synapse account?

answers.prompt: a) Yes, absolutely. They can decide whether to ignore me.
b) No, I should not use the data to re-identify participants in the first place.
c) Maybe.  It depends on the follow-up question I wish to ask.

questionOptions.prompt: You are analyzing data and are able to deduce the identity of data participants.  You would like to ask follow-up questions.  Should you contact them?

answers.prompt: a) Yes, absolutely. They can decide whether to ignore me.
b) No, I should not use the data to re-identify participants in the first place.
c) Maybe.  It depends on the follow-up question I wish to ask.

questionOptions.prompt: You are analyzing data and are able to deduce the identity of data participants.  You would like to ask follow-up questions.  Should you contact them?

answers.prompt: a) Project - All content placed in a 'Controlled' project, including wikis, files, folders, and tables, are subject to data use conditions.
b) Folder - All files placed in a 'Controlled'  folder is subject to specified data use conditions.  Conditions are lifted from files as they are moved out of this folder.
c) File - 'Controlled' files are subject to data use conditions no matter where on Synapse they reside.
d) User - 'Controlled' users must agree to data use conditions before viewing any content in Synapse

questionOptions.prompt: Synapse users can specify 'Conditions for use' when placing content in Synapse.  At what level are these conditions applied (choose all that apply)?

answers.prompt: a) Project - All content placed in a 'Controlled' project, including wikis, files, folders, and tables, are subject to data use conditions.
b) Folder - All files placed in a 'Controlled'  folder is subject to specified data use conditions.  Conditions are lifted from files as they are moved out of this folder.
c) File - 'Controlled' files are subject to data use conditions no matter where on Synapse they reside.
d) User - 'Controlled' users must agree to data use conditions before viewing any content in Synapse

questionOptions.prompt: Synapse users can specify 'Conditions for use' when placing content in Synapse.  At what level are these conditions applied (choose all that apply)?

answers.prompt: a) Project - All content placed in a 'Controlled' project, including wikis, files, folders, and tables, are subject to data use conditions.
b) Folder - All files placed in a 'Controlled'  folder is subject to specified data use conditions.  Conditions are lifted from files as they are moved out of this folder.
c) File - 'Controlled' files are subject to data use conditions no matter where on Synapse they reside.
d) User - 'Controlled' users must agree to data use conditions before viewing any content in Synapse

questionOptions.prompt: Synapse users can specify 'Conditions for use' when placing content in Synapse.  At what level are these conditions applied (choose all that apply)?

answers.prompt: a) I click the "change" link next to the folder or file name and follow the instructions on the Web page

questionOptions.prompt: How do I add "Condition for Use" to my content when necessary? (select all that apply)

answers.prompt: a) I cannot share content with everyone.  Synapse is a private platform.
b) I can upload the content into a "Public" folder.
c) By setting the sharing conditions of my content to "Public".
d) Any content I place in Synapse is automatically shared with everyone.

questionOptions.prompt: How can I share content with everyone? (Select all that apply)

answers.prompt: a) I click the "change" link next to the folder or file name and follow the instructions on the Web page
b) I load the content into an existing "Controlled Access" folder
c) I write the condition for use in the description wiki
d) I only share the folder with people I choose
